ACT
239
Retention of inheritance
If a person reports to the court that he/she is considered the decedent's heir or recorder , the court will retain the decedent's belongings that would be sufficient for that right until the body of the foreign state decides on that right.
After the authority of the foreign state makes a final decision on its right, the court will execute this decision regarding the retained items with respect to the reported request, and then hand over the rest to the authority of the foreign state.
If a creditor of the decedent files a claim, the court will retain as many of the decedent's belongings as are necessary to cover that claim until it is settled or secured.
